summary: Premium flag and status query appear implemented on backend (with migration) and consumed on frontend via a new React Query hook; frontend composer and Todayâ€™s Status UI were updated to handle premium gating and multiple check-ins display. However, evidence is insufficient in the provided diff summary to confirm backend enforcement of the 1/day limit for free users and query invalidation behavior after additional premium submissions.

missing_requirements.requirement: Update backend check-in submission rules so free users can submit at most 1 check-in per day, while premium users can submit multiple check-ins per day.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff snippet for backend/main.mo is truncated before any submitCheckIn logic; no shown changes demonstrate enforcing a 1/day limit for non-premium users or allowing multiple submissions for premium users with a clear rejection message for the second free submission.

missing_requirements.requirement: Submitting an additional premium check-in invalidates today/history queries and the UI updates accordingly.
missing_requirements.reason: While the composer now blocks non-premium users and uses a new premium-status query hook, the diff summary shows no modifications to the submit mutation hook (useSubmitCheckIn) or any explicit invalidation of today/history queries on success; therefore this AC cannot be confirmed from the provided diff.
evidence: frontend-file-summaries.txt (useSubmitCheckIn listed but not shown as modified)
